titleStmt.title: Musgraves musle broken, or Truth pleading against falshood; being a just defence and answer to two papers read by Sir Arthur Haslerig: set forth in a letter written to Mr. Moyer, one of the commissioners for compounding. Wherein is discovered how the common-wealth is abused by sub-cummissioners for sequestrations, and a revenue of 13000 l. per annum brought into the state, upon the discovery and charge of John Musgrave.
titleStmt.author: Musgrave, John, fl. 1654.

titleStmt.title: Musgraves musle broken, or Truth pleading against falshood; being a just defence and answer to two papers read by Sir Arthur Haslerig: set forth in a letter written to Mr. Moyer, one of the commissioners for compounding. Wherein is discovered how the common-wealth is abused by sub-cummissioners for sequestrations, and a revenue of 13000 l. per annum brought into the state, upon the discovery and charge of John Musgrave.
titleStmt.author: Musgrave, John, fl. 1654.

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Price, John. Musgrave muzl'd: or the mouth of iniquitie stoped. 1651.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

orgName.name: England and Wales.
